intro: Zetagyne, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple ray florets and a central disk of yellow tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils, demonstrating its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually silver or gray-green, covered in fine hairs that help reduce water loss. Zetagyne is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
